name: furnace production, pellets, with silo, 300kW | furnace, pellets, with silo, 300kW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6146/documentation

This dataset represent the production and the disposal of a wood-pellets burning furnace for local heating networks, with a storage silo. Its assumed lifetime is 20 years.

From reception of furnace components at the factory gate

This activity ends with the disposal of the device in the end of its lifetime. The dataset includes the most important materials used for the fabrication of the furnace, the pellets storage silo, the automatic screw conveyor system and chimney flue pipes: steel, steel alloys, aluminium, concrete, rock wool, plastics, electronic components, polystyrene, lubricating oil, paint. The dataset includes the concrete basement for the furnace room (around 13m2), the energy and heat for the construction and the disposal of the device. It is assumed to build the pellet storage silo (dimensions: 6x6x3.5m) in a separate space next to the existing furnace room.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This model of furnace is commercialized since 2010 in Europe and Switzerland and is still available on the market (end 2011)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Boiler of modern technology available on European and Swiss market, with combustion chamber in refractory bricks, designed for an optimal combustion process (cyclone integrated). The model of reference is a pellet boiler, mod.KWB Powerfire 300 kW. Represent the typical boiler for providing heat for local heating networks, commercial premises and multi-storey housing.;Source of image: http://www.kwb.at/at/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=194&Itemid=170
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: literature, furnace manual available for customers, investigation and personal communication from producer and technician
